content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

The following table shows employment data for Country <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>'s working-age population.

Cyclically unemployed
 <math alttext="4,000"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Frictionally unemployed
 <math alttext="1,000"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Structurally unemployed
 <math alttext="2,000"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow></math>

Employed
 <math alttext="63,000"><mstyle><mrow><mn>63</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Not in the labor force
 <math alttext="30,000"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

(a) Calculate the unemployment rate for Country <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.

(b) Calculate the labor force participation rate for Country <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.

(c) Is Country <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> currently producing at its potential real output? Explain.

(d) Assuming constant opportunity costs, draw a correctly labeled graph of country <math alttext="Z"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>’s <math alttext="P P C"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PPC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, showing consumer goods on the horizontal axis and capital goods on the vertical axis. Label a point <math alttext="W"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on the graph that reflects the current level of unemployment.
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.

frqParts.text: Respond to all parts of the question.

topic.text: 1.2: Opportunity Cost and the Production Possibilities Curve (PPC)

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
